quotes.author: C S Lewis
quotes.quote: A sum can be put right; but only by going back till you find the error and working it afresh from that point, never by simply going on.

quotes.author: John Dewey
quotes.quote: It is a familiar and significant saying that a problem well put is half-solved.

quotes.author: Brian Kernighan
quotes.quote: The most effective debugging tool is still careful thought, coupled with judiciously placed print statements.

quotes.author: Brian Kernighan
quotes.quote: 90% of the functionality delivered now is better than 100% delivered never.

quotes.author: Albert Einstein
quotes.quote: A clever person solves a problem. A wise person avoids it.

quotes.author: Albert Einstein
quotes.quote: The formulation of the problem is often more essential than its solution, which may be merely a matter of mathematical or experimental skill.

quotes.author: Atul Gawande
quotes.quote: We always hope for the easy fix: the one simple change that will erase a problem in a stroke. But few things in life work this way. Instead, success requires making a hundred small steps go right.

quotes.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quotes.quote: Perfection is achieved, not when there is nothing more to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.

quotes.author: Robert C. Martin
quotes.quote: A long descriptive name is better than a short enigmatic name. A long descriptive name is better than a long descriptive comment.

quotes.author: Robert C. Martin
quotes.quote: If you want to go fast, if you want to get done quickly, if you want your code to be easy to write, make it easy to read.

quotes.author: Robert C. Martin
quotes.quote: When you are working on a problem, you sometimes get so close to it that you can’t see all the options. You miss elegant solutions because the creative part of your mind is suppressed by the intensity of your focus.

quotes.author: Robert C. Martin
quotes.quote: Programming is a social activity.

quotes.author: Robert C. Martin
quotes.quote: The only way to go fast, is to go well.

quotes.author: Robert C. Martin
quotes.quote: One difference between a smart programmer and a professional programmer is that the professional understands that clarity is king.

quotes.author: Eric Schmidt
quotes.quote: There's nothing that cannot be found through some search engine or on the Internet somewhere.

quotes.author: Donald Knuth
quotes.quote: Programming is the art of telling another human being what one wants the computer to do.

quotes.author: Donald Knuth
quotes.quote: Programs are meant to be read by humans and only incidentally for computers to execute.

quotes.author: Donald Knuth
quotes.quote: Always remember, however, that there’s usually a simpler and better way to do something than the first way that pops into your head.

quotes.author: Bjarne Stroustrup
quotes.quote: The most fundamental problem in software development is complexity. There is only one basic way of dealing with complexity: divide and conquer.

quotes.author: Bjarne Stroustrup
quotes.quote: The most important single aspect of software development is to be clear about what you are trying to build.

quotes.author: Bjarne Stroustrup
quotes.quote: It's easy to win forgiveness for being wrong; being right is what gets you into real trouble.

quotes.author: Joshua Block
quotes.quote: I will cheerfully spend literally hours on identifier names: variable names, method names, and so forth, to make my code readable.

quotes.author: Ken Thompson
quotes.quote: It's always good to take an orthogonal view of something. It develops ideas.

quotes.author: Ken Thompson
quotes.quote: When in doubt, use brute force.

quotes.author: Linus Torvalds
quotes.quote: Bad programmers worry about the code. Good programmers worry about data structures and their relationships.

quotes.author: Rob Pike
quotes.quote: Data dominates. If you've chosen the right data structures and organized things well, the algorithms will almost always be self-evident.

quotes.author: Rob Pike
quotes.quote: Object-oriented design is the roman numerals of computing.

quotes.author: Rob Pike
quotes.quote: Eventually, I decided that thinking was not getting me very far and it was time to try building.

quotes.author: Eric Schmidt
quotes.quote: The Internet is the first thing that humanity has built that humanity doesn't understand, the largest experiment in anarchy that we have ever had.

quotes.author: Brian Kernighan
quotes.quote: Controlling complexity is the essence of computer programming.

quotes.author: Robert C. Martin
quotes.quote: Programmers must avoid leaving false clues that obscure the meaning of code.

quotes.author: Brian Kernighan
quotes.quote: Another effective [debugging] technique is to explain your code to someone else. This will often cause you to explain the bug to yourself.

quotes.author: Alexander Graham Bell
quotes.quote: Great discoveries and improvements invariably involve the cooperation of many minds.

quotes.author: Christopher Strachey
quotes.quote: You can't see the semantic wood for the syntactic trees.

quotes.author: Nita Leland
quotes.quote: Pay attention to the inner voice that tells you when something feels right. Much of your creative problem-solving occurs at an unconscious level.

quotes.author: Brian Kernighan
quotes.quote: One university computer center kept a teddy bear near the help desk. Students with mysterious bugs were required to explain them to the bear before they could speak to a human counselor.

quotes.author: Brian Kernighan
quotes.quote: Mechanical rules are never a substitute for clarity of thought.

quotes.author: Brian Kernighan
quotes.quote: Believe the terrain, not the map.

quotes.author: Scott Berkun
quotes.quote: The best lesson from the myths of Newton and Archimedes is to work passionately but to take breaks. Sitting under trees and relaxing in baths lets the mind wander and frees the subconscious to do work on our behalf.

quotes.author: Scott Berkun
quotes.quote: Increasing creativeness doesn’t require anything more than increasing your observations: become more aware of possible combinations.

quotes.author: Scott Berkun
quotes.quote: The bottleneck is never code or creativity; it's lack of clarity.

quotes.author: Mary Poppendieck
quotes.quote: The biggest cause of failure in software-intensive systems is not technical failure; it’s building the wrong thing.

quotes.author: Mary Poppendieck
quotes.quote: The most successful development occurs when developers talk directly to customers or are part of business teams.

quotes.author: Steve McConnell
quotes.quote: The big optimizations come from refining the high-level design, not the individual routines.

quotes.author: Steve McConnell
quotes.quote: Spend your time on the 20 percent of the refactorings that provide 80 percent of the benefit.

quotes.author: Steve McConnell
quotes.quote: The single most important reason to create a routine is to reduce a program's complexity. Create a routine to hide information so that you won't need to think about it.

quotes.author: Steve McConnell
quotes.quote: Few people can understand more than three levels of nested ifs.

quotes.author: Steve McConnell
quotes.quote: The most challenging part of programming is conceptualizing the problem, and many errors in programming are conceptual errors.

quotes.author: Steve McConnell
quotes.quote: Modern software is inherently complex, and no matter how hard you try, you'll eventually bump into some level of complexity that's inherent in the real-world problem itself.

quotes.author: Steve McConnell
quotes.quote: It's better to strive for a good solution and avoid disaster rather than trying to find the best solution.

quotes.author: Robert H Schuller
quotes.quote: Again and again, the impossible problem is solved when we see that the problem is only a tough decision waiting to be made.

quotes.author: Sherlock Holmes
quotes.quote: When you have eliminated the impossible, whatever remains, however improbable, must be the truth.

quotes.author: Thomas Alba Edison
quotes.quote: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
